str2: Neither, nor, not even, and not. From ou and de; not however, i.e. Neither, nor, not even.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Abraham, progenitor of the Hebrew race. Of Hebrew origin; Abraham, the Hebrew patriarch.
From speiro; something sown, i.e. Seed; by implication, offspring; specially, a remnant.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
A child, descendent, inhabitant. From the base of timoria; a child.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
(Hebrew), Isaac, the patriarch. Of Hebrew origin; Isaac, the son of Abraham.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
From speiro; something sown, i.e. Seed; by implication, offspring; specially, a remnant.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I call, summon, invite, (b) I call, name. Akin to the base of keleuo; to 'call'.
